hackathon-description-text: Hack HSV is Alabama's first high school hackathon: a 12-hour coding marathon where you will collaborate with friends to program a project.
hackathon-eligibility: Students 13-18 from any part of the world is eligible to join!
hackathon-requirements: Students are able to program in any language they know, on any platform. This can span from C++, to Swift, to even Scratch. Using this, you will be creating any project, and submitting the final products here on Devpost where judges and students will be able to see your awesome creations!
hackathon-rules: You can find all the rules during registration.
hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=4915 Garth Rd SE, Huntsville, AL 35802, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: (20) How creative and unique is your project?
(5) How well did you show off your awesome project?
(10) Overall, how clean, and well designed is your project?

hackathon-location-address: 4915 Garth Rd SE, Huntsville, AL 35802, USA
hackathon-description-header: 2nd annual high school coding marathon in Alabama! Students come to Hack HSV to program projects, transform dreams into realities, and to meet others.
